p: Body length had a positive, although weak, effect on female mortality and a stronger negative effect on that of pups ( Fig 6A). We calculated the success of female-pup pairs using Aggreg = 3 and Dist = 150 km, in two conditions of abundance (intermediate and high). In such conditions, females with a body length of 115 cm or more were the most successful ( SP > 0.8; Fig 6B). On average, the longest females (â‰¥ 115 cm) performed the longest trips ( Fig 6C and 6D). Conversely, NbrFishing and the NbrTrip both decreased with increasing female body length. Thus, longer females exploited distant resources more efficiently than shorter ones.
